intro: Cyathea kanehirae, commonly known as the Kanehirae tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the tropical forests of Hawaii. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in its natural habitat. Its fronds are typically dark green and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental value. Cyathea kanehirae plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystem, providing habitat and shelter for various native species.
